column7: Getting ready for another chat with Dr Aderin-Pocock! #ssf15 http://t.co/JOFK73cGkp

column4: Incredibly packed theatre for MP #ssf15 http://t.co/b64DNE2nEi
Starts by asking "if space travel was as safe/affordable as flight travel  who would go into space?"  *whole room raises both arms*  #ssf15
Great to see so many school groups and kids enthusiastic about space and astronomy at the @maasmuseum today #ssf15
MP says Dyslexia impacted her education a lot. Asks "are there any dyslexics in the house?" *few arms* MP: "Yaassss" #ssf15
MP: When people think of scientists  they usually think of someone white  male and very very serious #ssf15
MP shows her students this photo and asks spot the scientist. And people go for the white  men #ssf15 http://t.co/FWL2ZSNoBY
MP: it's important for kids to see that you don't need to be a boy  white or exceptionally serious to be a scientist #ssf15
(The bottom photo is of MP and her husband - both scientists) #ssf15
RT @SydScienceFest: MP shows her students this photo and asks spot the scientist. And people go for the white  men #ssf15 http://t.co/FWL2Zâ€¦
RT @SydScienceFest: MP: it's important for kids to see that you don't need to be a boy  white or exceptionally serious to be a scientist #sâ€¦
RT @SydScienceFest: (The bottom photo is of MP and her husband - both scientists) #ssf15
We are now learning about the ridiculous processes involved in having to go to the toilet in space (spoiler: locked doors and straps) #ssf15
MP has a plan to get herself into space. This plan is basically...  Big Brother meets interplanetary travel! #ssf15
Biggest problem for space travel is cost. So  the Big Brother Space Travel idea solves that with reality TV funding.  Seriously.  #ssf15
Also  the whole eviction thing... But MP solves this problem by saying the winners get to go home. Losers stay in space. #ssf15
The school kids in the audience seem very  very keen on this idea. #ssf15
MP: who here would make a one-way trip to Mars?  *about two hands go up"  MP: That's INCREDIBLE #ssf15
The cost of getting 1.5 kgs into space costs somewhere between $70-100k. That's the cost for only 1.5L of water! #ssf15
MP: One of the best things about space travel (now) is that you are all from Earth. You just have to work together. Eg. @ISS_Research #ssf15
Reminder this is on tomorrow!! #ssf15 https://t.co/J3ZtcZfTCV
MP: The evolution of scientific ideas coupled with seeing how the cost of any kind of travel eventually drops supports space travel #ssf15
MP: So many factors against us potentially meeting other life in space. #ssf15
MP: What if aliens saw Earth with dinosaurs and just thought "lets get out of here" #ssf15
Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock is wrapping up her talk now with some questions #ssf15
First question from young girl: what do you think aliens would look like  MP: I've prepared an image actually #ssf15 http://t.co/orWBw8lunQ
Next Q: "What evidence do we have that a black hole is at the centre of our galaxy?" #ssf15
MP: Detecting black holes are tricky because they don't emit light but stars move around them #ssf15
MP: So you can detect them by watching the movements of nearby stars #ssf15
(On a Big Bang question)MP: The name Big Bang was an insult used to discredit the theory. Similar to 'The God Particle' #ssf15
Small boy: The News said that a galaxy is going to crash into us  MP: Yes  yes that's right  there is  unfortunately  #ssf15
Dr Maggie Aderin-Pocock is done for her talk now. But check out our other events coming up. We are only getting started! #ssf15 #natsciwk
A reminder that Ken Silburn will speaking tonight at the @maasmuseum for the 'Einstein Lecture'. #ssf15
